TextView.value: LootManager - Feature Guide
BASIC SETUP:
• Rename bags to contain 'loot' (case sensitive)
• Items will move to any bag with 'loot' in name (loot1, loot2, etc.)
• You may notice bags opening/closing - this is normal
MAIN OPTIONS:
• Enabled: Turn LootManager on/off
• Delete Leftovers: Delete items NOT in your loot rules
• Loot All: Loot ALL items and move them to loot bags
(ignores your loot list completely)
• Leave corpse open: Keep corpses open after processing
• Disable when full: Stop looting when bags are full
IMPORTANT - MUTUAL EXCLUSIVITY:
• 'Delete Leftovers' and 'Loot All' cannot both be enabled
• Enabling one will automatically disable the other
• This prevents accidentally deleting everything!
MATCH TYPES (Per Item):
• Exact: Item name must match EXACTLY
Example: 'Monster Parts' only matches 'Monster Parts'
• Not Exact: Partial matching allowed
Example: 'Monster' matches 'Monster Parts', 'Monster Claw', etc.
ITEM SETTINGS:
• Min/Max QL: Quality level range (1-500)
• Quantity: How many to loot (999 = infinite)
• Global Scope: Rule applies to all characters
DYNAMIC LIST UPDATES:
• Adding items to your loot list while corpses are open
will immediately check and loot those items
• No need to close and reopen corpses!
NAME SEARCH & AUTOCOMPLETE:
• Type in the Name field to search for items
• Suggestions appear below the Name field as you type
• Database contains thousands of AO items
• Suggestions display 4-5 items per line
• Multiple lines show when many matches found
• Click on any suggestion to auto-fill the Name field
• Suggestions update in real-time as you type
• Search is case-insensitive (Monster = monster)
• Partial matches work (typing 'part' finds 'Monster Parts')
SAVE & LOAD CONFIGURATIONS:
• /lmsave <name> - Save current rules with custom name
• /lmload <name> - Load named configuration
• /lmlist - Show all available configurations
• Files saved to SavedLootLists folder for organization
• Examples: /lmsave Monster Parts, /lmload Monster Parts
• Save List button shows command examples
• Load List button shows available configurations
• Perfect for switching between loot sets for different instances or tasks
